<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Close your eyes and pretend you’re back in 10th-grade homeroom, because this is your principal and we have some announcements:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Morning Brew has a TikTok! And it’s quite funny. </span><span><a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@morning_brew?lang=en" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Go check it out</a></span><span>.</span>

<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If you’re not into TikTok...maybe you’re into doing crossword puzzles. We publish them every Saturday and want to feature puzzles from our own brilliant readers. </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/13/morning-brew-crossword-submission-guidelines" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read up here</a></span><span> on how to make your own crossword (it’s really not as impossible as you think).</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPAC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/26/wework-going-public-via-spac?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We(Finally)Work
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SHANGHAI, CHINA - AUGUST 13, 2019 - Employees work at a WeWork office in..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTIxL3dld29yay5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Barcroft Media/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Four words we didn’t know would ever make it to the Brew? WeWork is going public. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rumors are true: The shared office space company <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-agrees-to-spac-deal-that-would-take-startup-public-11616752804?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is merging</a> with a SPAC, BowX Acquisition Corp., to make its debut in the public markets, which have been waiting for WeWork like a prom date at the bottom of the stairs since 2019.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">WeWork’s character arc was looking very Sméagol → Gollum back then... </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A recap: </strong>Cofounder and former CEO Adam Neumann tried and failed to take WeWork public in fall 2019. The big trouble came when the company’s S-1 filing was made public, revealing a murky corporate governance structure and a dog-ate-my-homework business plan: The company spent almost double what it made and had no clear path to become profitable in the future. In other words, the emperor had no clothes and no plans to buy any. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeWork’s value plummeted from $47 billion at its peak to $2.9 billion post-meltdown. In the months that followed, Neumann was stripped of all his titles and SoftBank, an existing mega-investor in WeWork, swooped in to bail the company out with a $5+ billion infusion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, WeWork is back up to a respectable $9 billion valuation. To tie it back to Tolkien: WeWork’s looking more Gandalf the White than Gollum. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What changed? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Covid-19 ushered in a work-from-anywhere revolution, but “anywhere” being the couch or the bed quickly lost its appeal. Now, flexible office space is back in demand, and WeWork 2.0 provides just that. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>CEO Sandeep Mathrani expects WeWork to turn a profit by the end of this year, following some </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/12/wework-cash-flow-positive-2021-says-chairman?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">belt-tightening</a></span><span> measures he made last summer. Mathrani told the WSJ that WeWork has cut jobs, re-worked lease agreements, and sold off assets. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The company has narrowed its focus from Neumann’s zany plan to “elevate the world’s consciousness” to being “more or less, a normal real estate company,” as finance professor Jay Ritter <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/26/business/WeWork-Spac-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a> to the NYT. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/26/vaccine-tracker-march-27?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="Six%20states%20are%20now%20offering%20Covid-19%20vaccinations%20to%20all%20residents%2016%20or%20older" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="vaccine map " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTE5L3ZhY2NpbmVfbWFwLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://twitter.com/AriadneLabs" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ariadne Labs</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s our weekly tradition that we hope will end soon.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the US...</strong>yesterday, the country broke its record for most doses administered in a single day: <a href="https://www.axios.com/vaccine-daily-record-0da0a2d5-e494-4413-af4f-9babea418cbc.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3.4 million</a>. At the current rate, the US would hit President Biden’s new goal of 200 million shots administered in his first 100 days. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Around the world…</strong>growing supply could allow <a href="https://www.axios.com/most-world-may-be-vaccinated-2021-if-equitable-2ddbf35d-8a44-4733-bced-1c932eafad7f.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">70% of the global population</a> to be vaccinated this year, per new research from the Duke Global Health Innovation Center. But short-term hurdles remain: India is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/25/world/asia/india-covid-vaccine-astrazeneca.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restricting exports</a> of its vaccine stockpile as it confronts a surge in cases.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">More headlines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Come one, come all: </strong>Six states are now offering Covid-19 vaccinations to all residents 16 or older, and at least <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/03/23/health/covid-19-vaccine-eligible-to-all-states-timeline-wellness/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">30 others</a> plan to open up eligibility to adults before the end of April, according to CNN. Check out the map above from Ariadne Labs for a more comprehensive timeline.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">They are the future, after all: </strong>Pfizer <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/25/covid-vaccine-pfizer-begins-trial-on-infants-and-young-kids.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicked off</a> clinical trials this week for testing its Covid-19 vaccine on kids aged 6 months to 11 years old. Moderna said earlier this month it had started testing its vaccine on kids.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ELECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/26/dominion-voting-systems-files-16-billion-lawsuit-fox-news?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dominion Isn’t One for Casual Fridays
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dominion Voting Systems ditched the Hawaiian shirt and khakis yesterday, instead filing a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-donald-trump-media-lawsuits-elections-912eea8e168f95d51dec02da78ac2760?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.6 billion lawsuit</a> against Fox News. The suit alleges that the news giant played a key role in circulating false claims that Dominion’s voting machines were used to rig the election against Donald Trump. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The lawsuit argues that Fox News leveraged its platform to defame Dominion, severely damaging its business in the process. “If this case does not rise to the level of defamation by a broadcaster, then nothing does,” reads a copy of the lawsuit seen by the AP. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Dominion has filed separate defamation lawsuits against several members of Trump’s posse, including lawyer Rudy Guliani, attorney Sidney Powell, and MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell. And yesterday, lawyers for Dominion <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/26/dominion-signals-it-could-sue-fox-news-hosts-after-seeking-1point6-billion-in-damages.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">left the door open</a> for going after individual Fox News broadcasters as well. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> While the cases brought against Fox are mounting, it still enjoys <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/26/business/media/fox-news-defamation-suit-dominion.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sizable</a> First Amendment protections as a news organization. Dominion lawyers would have to show that Fox “acted with ‘actual malice’ and ‘reckless disregard’ for the truth, typically a high standard to meet,” writes the NYT. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Listen, we don’t want to get ahead of ourselves. But life could get—what’s the word—<em>awesome</em> pretty soon. And you can <a href="https://www.harrys.com/go/email-newsletter-1?utm_medium=email%20newsletter&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=gsp-fttest&hid=202102campaign" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">look your best for the Awesome Era with Harry’s</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As life returns to normal-ish, you can try Harry’s new, sharper blades. We’ve heard from guys who shave four times a week, and they say <strong style="color:#000">the eighth shave is just as smooth as the first</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even though they upgraded their razors, <strong style="color:#000">Harry’s</strong> <strong style="color:#000">prices are staying the same</strong>, aka $2 per blade for an eight-pack. So even if life goes from boring to bonkers, your shaving costs won’t budge. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Harry’s is confident you’ll enjoy their stuff, so <a href="https://www.harrys.com/go/email-newsletter-1?utm_medium=email%20newsletter&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=gsp-fttest&hid=202102campaign" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">they’re offering a special trial offer for Morning Brew readers</a>. You’ll get:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A five-blade razor</span></li>

</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">All for free</strong>; just cover $3 for shipping when you sign up through any of the links here. <a href="https://www.harrys.com/go/email-newsletter-1?utm_medium=email%20newsletter&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=gsp-fttest&hid=202102campaign" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get your free shaving supplies—and get your moneymaker ready for primetime—here</a>. </p>

</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/26/key-performance-indicators-march-27" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="HBO Max" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTA1L3N0cmVhbWluZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>If you subscribed to all flagship streaming services from big media/tech companies, your bill would come out to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-26/disney-netflix-hikes-bring-cost-of-cord-cutter-package-to-92?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$92/month</a>, according to Bloomberg. That’s just about on par with the cost of a typical cable TV package: $93.50/month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bonus stat: </strong>The unemployment rate in South Dakota is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-26/unemployment-rate-of-2-9-in-south-dakota-shows-uneven-recovery?utm_source=google&utm_medium=bd&cmpId=google&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just 2.9%</a>, compared to the national rate of 6.2%. The economic recovery has been uneven across geographic lines. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“It's never good news when a bunch of people learn the name of a boat.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Philip Bump, national correspondent for the Washington Post, summed up this week’s disaster-you-couldn’t-look-away-from in a <a href="https://twitter.com/pbump/status/1375163492567818240?s=09&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">single tweet</a>. The boat he’s talking about, of course, is the Ever Given, whose traffic mishap in the Suez Canal has caused utter chaos in global trade. The ship will probably remain stuck in the canal, blocking all traffic, until at least next week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Your Saturday deep dive into the underworld of finch smuggling. (<a href="https://www.guernicamag.com/bad-birds-in-quarantine/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Guernica</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEMOGRAPHICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/26/germany-avoids-baby-bust-rising-birth-rates?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Das Sind Viele Babys
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/26/germany-avoids-baby-bust-rising-birth-rates" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Newborn baby in hospital bed surrounded by empty hospital beds" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTIwL2JhYnlfaW5faG9zcGl0YWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sean Gallup/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Germany’s federal statistics office found that the country got busy <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/a70268b4-8f2a-4b59-9942-435dc1e39d86?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increasing</a> its birth rate by 0.8% in December 2020 and January 2021, about nine months after the pandemic started.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This jump in births runs counter to the current and even pre-pandemic fertility rates in the rest of Europe, the US, and other wealthy nations: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There will be 300,000 fewer births this year in the US, according to estimates.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>China reported a 12% drop in births from 2019–2020.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Countries with older populations showed their age. Italy, for example, reported its lowest birth rate last year in over a century.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Nothin’ hotter than chaos.</strong> Recessions and pandemics tend to lead to lower fertility rates, and the US still hasn’t recovered from the 2008 financial crisis baby bust. And while fewer births = fewer baby showers you have to go to, a steady decline exacerbated by economic instability can funk up everything from social security to interest rates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How did Germany do it?</strong> No one’s totally sure, but some economists are pointing to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-03/how-germany-pays-workers-when-their-work-dries-up-quicktake?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kurzarbeit</a>, Germany’s state-funded safety net. The Brew is pointing to Berlin’s sexy brutalist architecture.</p>

FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew's Bookshelf</a> brings you a few of our favorite, business-related reads. On this special Saturday edition, let's try questioning everything we know.</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>When organizational psychologist Adam Grant drops a new book, you drop everything and read it. His latest, </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781984878106?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Think Again</em></a></span><span>, teaches you to embrace the possibilities that come with changing your mind. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It's probably blasphemous for us to even mention...but </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780525536550?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>A World Without Email</em></a></span><span> from productivity expert Cal Newport offers insight into how we developed our inbox addiction and what to do about it.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Sarah Jaffe's </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781568589398?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Work Won't Love You Back</em></a></span><span> challenges the importance of work as part of your identity and breaks down how "doing what you love" has tricked people into a new tyranny of labor. </span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFour words we didn’t know would ever make it to the Brew? WeWork is going public. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe rumors are true: The shared office space company \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-agrees-to-spac-deal-that-would-take-startup-public-11616752804?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis merging\u003c/a\u003e with a SPAC, BowX Acquisition Corp., to make its debut in the public markets, which have been waiting for WeWork like a prom date at the bottom of the stairs since 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWeWork’s character arc was looking very Sméagol → Gollum back then... \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA recap: \u003c/strong\u003eCofounder and former CEO Adam Neumann tried and failed to take WeWork public in fall 2019. The big trouble came when the company’s S-1 filing was made public, revealing a murky corporate governance structure and a dog-ate-my-homework business plan: The company spent almost double what it made and had no clear path to become profitable in the future. In other words, the emperor had no clothes and no plans to buy any. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWeWork’s value plummeted from $47 billion at its peak to $2.9 billion post-meltdown. In the months that followed, Neumann was stripped of all his titles and SoftBank, an existing mega-investor in WeWork, swooped in to bail the company out with a $5+ billion infusion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, WeWork is back up to a respectable $9 billion valuation. To tie it back to Tolkien: WeWork’s looking more Gandalf the White than Gollum. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat changed? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCovid-19 ushered in a work-from-anywhere revolution, but “anywhere” being the couch or the bed quickly lost its appeal. Now, flexible office space is back in demand, and WeWork 2.0 provides just that. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCEO Sandeep Mathrani expects WeWork to turn a profit by the end of this year, following some \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/12/wework-cash-flow-positive-2021-says-chairman?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebelt-tightening\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e measures he made last summer. Mathrani told the WSJ that WeWork has cut jobs, re-worked lease agreements, and sold off assets. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe company has narrowed its focus from Neumann’s zany plan to “elevate the world’s consciousness” to being “more or less, a normal real estate company,” as finance professor Jay Ritter \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/26/business/WeWork-Spac-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained\u003c/a\u003e to the NYT. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" But short-term hurdles remain: India is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/25/world/asia/india-covid-vaccine-astrazeneca.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erestricting exports\u003c/a\u003e of its vaccine stockpile as it confronts a surge in cases.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMore headlines\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCome one, come all: \u003c/strong\u003eSix states are now offering Covid-19 vaccinations to all residents 16 or older, and at least \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/03/23/health/covid-19-vaccine-eligible-to-all-states-timeline-wellness/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e30 others\u003c/a\u003e plan to open up eligibility to adults before the end of April, according to CNN. Check out the map above from Ariadne Labs for a more comprehensive timeline.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThey are the future, after all: \u003c/strong\u003ePfizer \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/25/covid-vaccine-pfizer-begins-trial-on-infants-and-young-kids.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekicked off\u003c/a\u003e clinical trials this week for testing its Covid-19 vaccine on kids aged 6 months to 11 years old. Fridays\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDominion Voting Systems ditched the Hawaiian shirt and khakis yesterday, instead filing a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-donald-trump-media-lawsuits-elections-912eea8e168f95d51dec02da78ac2760?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.6 billion lawsuit\u003c/a\u003e against Fox News. The suit alleges that the news giant played a key role in circulating false claims that Dominion’s voting machines were used to rig the election against Donald Trump. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe lawsuit argues that Fox News leveraged its platform to defame Dominion, severely damaging its business in the process. “If this case does not rise to the level of defamation by a broadcaster, then nothing does,” reads a copy of the lawsuit seen by the AP. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDominion has filed separate defamation lawsuits against several members of Trump’s posse, including lawyer Rudy Guliani, attorney Sidney Powell, and MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell. And yesterday, lawyers for Dominion \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/26/dominion-signals-it-could-sue-fox-news-hosts-after-seeking-1point6-billion-in-damages.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleft the door open\u003c/a\u003e for going after individual Fox News broadcasters as well. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e While the cases brought against Fox are mounting, it still enjoys \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/26/business/media/fox-news-defamation-suit-dominion.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esizable\u003c/a\u003e First Amendment protections as a news organization. Dominion lawyers would have to show that Fox “acted with ‘actual malice’ and ‘reckless disregard’ for the truth, typically a high standard to meet,” writes the NYT. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStat: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you subscribed to all flagship streaming services from big media/tech The economic recovery has been uneven across geographic lines. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote: \u003c/strong\u003e“It's never good news when a bunch of people learn the name of a boat.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePhilip Bump, national correspondent for the Washington Post, summed up this week’s disaster-you-couldn’t-look-away-from in a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/pbump/status/1375163492567818240?s=09\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esingle tweet\u003c/a\u003e. The boat he’s talking about, of course, is the Ever Given, whose traffic mishap in the Suez Canal has caused utter chaos in global trade. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGermany’s federal statistics office found that the country got busy \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/a70268b4-8f2a-4b59-9942-435dc1e39d86?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreasing\u003c/a\u003e its birth rate by 0.8% in December 2020 and January 2021, about nine months after the pandemic started.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis jump in births runs counter to the current and even pre-pandemic fertility rates in the rest of Europe, the US, and other wealthy nations: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere will be 300,000 fewer births this year in the US, according to estimates.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina reported a 12% drop in births from 2019–2020.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCountries with older populations showed their age. Italy, for example, reported its lowest birth rate last year in over a century.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNothin’ hotter than chaos.\u003c/strong\u003e Recessions and pandemics tend to lead to lower fertility rates, and the US still hasn’t recovered from the 2008 financial crisis baby bust. And while fewer births = fewer baby showers you have to go to, a steady decline exacerbated by economic instability can funk up everything from social security to interest rates.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow did Germany do it?\u003c/strong\u003e No one’s totally sure, but some economists are pointing to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-03/how-germany-pays-workers-when-their-work-dries-up-quicktake?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eKurzarbeit\u003c/a\u003e, Germany’s state-funded safety net.
